article.Heading: Budget 2017: 5 things IIFL feels FM Arun Jaitley is likely to focus on
article.Summary: Expect an increase in tax exemption limit for the salaried class and a lowering of the existing corporate tax rate to stimulate economic growth.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

A snapshot of what broking firm IIFL expects from the upcoming Budget: 

(From the IIFL report)

* It will spur public spending towards building better infrastructure (roads, power, irrigation and railways), an increase in consumption and strong focus on digitalization.

* The recent demonetisation event has adversely impacted domestic economic growth. The government is likely to announce progressive policies for various sectors, thereby boosting market sentiment and the economy.

* The government's tax revenues would rise substantially on account of the taxes mopped up post demonetisation. Expect an increase in tax exemption limit for the salaried class and a lowering of the existing corporate tax rate to stimulate economic growth.

* A sustained effort to promote a cashless economy by introduction of tax sops for digital transactions. The government may also announce penalties on cash transactions, imposing taxes on cash withdrawal from the banking system.

* Overall market sentiment may dampen if the government raises the long term capital gain tax definition beyond the current one year period.
